description: Tulsi is a sacred plant in Indian culture, known for its medicinal properties such as anti-inflammatory, anti-viral, and antioxidant effects. It is used to treat respiratory disorders, boost immunity, and reduce stress.
habitat: Native to India, commonly found in gardens.
cultivation: Prefers warm climates and well-drained soil. Grows well in pots or garden beds.

description: Ashwagandha is a powerful adaptogen known for reducing stress and anxiety, improving vitality, and boosting immunity.
habitat: Native to India, grows well in arid regions.
cultivation: Prefers dry, well-drained soil and full sunlight.

description: Turmeric is widely known for its anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties. It plays a vital role in digestive health and traditional healing.
habitat: Native to Southeast Asia, requires a warm, humid climate.
cultivation: Grows in rich, well-drained soil with ample rainfall.

description: Cinnamon is used traditionally for managing blood sugar levels and has anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial benefits.
habitat: Native to Sri Lanka, thrives in tropical climates.
cultivation: Prefers warm, humid environments with well-drained soil.

description: Cardamom supports digestive health and has antimicrobial properties. It is widely used in traditional remedies and culinary practices.
habitat: Native to India, grows in tropical and subtropical climates.
cultivation: Requires a moist, tropical climate and well-drained soil.

description: Cloves are rich in antioxidants and widely used for pain relief, especially in dental care. They also have antibacterial properties.
habitat: Native to Indonesia, thrives in tropical climates.
cultivation: Prefers warm, humid conditions with rich, well-drained soil.
